00028 /*
00029  * lustre/ofd/ofd_grant.c
00030  *
00031  * This file provides code related to grant space management on Object Storage
00032  * Targets (OSTs). Grant is a mechanism used by client nodes to reserve disk
00033  * space on OSTs for the data writeback cache. The Lustre client is thus assured
00034  * that enough space will be available when flushing dirty pages asynchronously.
00035  * Each client node is granted an initial amount of reserved space at connect
00036  * time and gets additional space back from OST in bulk write reply.
00037  *
00038  * We actually support three different cases:
00039  * - The client supports the new grant parameters (i.e. OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM)
00040  *   which means that all grant overhead calculation happens on the client side.
00041  *   The server reports at connect time the backend filesystem block size, the
00042  *   maximum extent size as well as the extent insertion cost and it is then up
00043  *   to the osc layer to the track dirty extents and consume grant accordingly
00044  *   (see osc_cache.c). In each bulk write request, the client provides how much
00045  *   grant space was consumed for this RPC.
00046  * - The client does not support OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM and always assumes a
00047  *   a backend file system block size of 4KB. We then have two cases:
00048  *   - If the block size is really 4KB, then the client can deal with grant
00049  *     allocation for partial block writes, but won't take extent insertion cost
00050  *     into account. For such clients, we inflate grant by 100% on the server
00051  *     side. It means that when 32MB of grant is hold by the client, 64MB of
00052  *     grant space is actually reserved on the server. All grant counters
00053  *     provided by such a client are inflated by 100%.
00054  *   - The backend filesystem block size is bigger than 4KB, which isn't
00055  *     supported by the client. In this case, we emulate a 4KB block size and
00056  *     consume one block size on the server for each 4KB of grant returned to
00057  *     client. With a 128KB blocksize, it means that 32MB dirty pages of 4KB
00058  *     on the client will actually consume 1GB of grant on the server.
00059  *     All grant counters provided by such a client are inflated by the block
00060  *     size ratio.
00061  *
00062  * This file handles the core logic for:
00063  * - grant allocation strategy
00064  * - maintaining per-client as well as global grant space accounting
00065  * - processing grant information packed in incoming requests
00066  * - allocating server-side grant space for synchronous write RPCs which did not
00067  *   consume grant on the client side (OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT flag not set). If not
00068  *   enough space is available, such RPCs fail with ENOSPC
00069  *
00070  * Author: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>
00071  */
00072 
00073 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_FILTER
00074 
00075 #include "ofd_internal.h"
00076 
00077 /* Clients typically hold 2x their max_rpcs_in_flight of grant space */
00078 #define OFD_GRANT_SHRINK_LIMIT(exp)     (2ULL * 8 * exp_max_brw_size(exp))
00079 
00080 /* Helpers to inflate/deflate grants for clients that do not support the grant
00081  * parameters */
00082 static inline u64 ofd_grant_inflate(struct ofd_device *ofd, u64 val)
00083 {
00084         if (ofd->ofd_blockbits > COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT)
00085                 /* Client does not support such large block size, grant
00086                  * is thus inflated. We already significantly overestimate
00087                  * overhead, no need to add the extent tax in this case */
00088                 return val << (ofd->ofd_blockbits - COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT);
00089         /* client can deal with the block size, but does not support per-extent
00090          * grant accounting, inflate grant by 100% for such clients */
00091         return val << 1;
00092 }
00093 
00094 /* Companion of ofd_grant_inflate() */
00095 static inline u64 ofd_grant_deflate(struct ofd_device *ofd, u64 val)
00096 {
00097         if (ofd->ofd_blockbits > COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT)
00098                 return val >> (ofd->ofd_blockbits - COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT);
00099         return val >> 1;
00100 }
00101 
00102 /* Grant chunk is used as a unit for grant allocation. It should be inflated
00103  * if the client does not support the grant paramaters.
00104  * Check connection flag against \a data if not NULL. This is used during
00105  * connection creation where exp->exp_connect_data isn't populated yet */
00106 static inline u64 ofd_grant_chunk(struct obd_export *exp,
00107                                   struct ofd_device *ofd,
00108                                   struct obd_connect_data *data)
00109 {
00110         u64 chunk = exp_max_brw_size(exp);
00111         u64 tax;
00112 
00113         if (ofd_obd(ofd)->obd_self_export == exp)
00114                 /* Grant enough space to handle a big precreate request */
00115                 return OST_MAX_PRECREATE * ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_inodespace / 2;
00116 
00117         if ((data == NULL && !ofd_grant_param_supp(exp)) ||
00118             (data != NULL && !OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, GRANT_PARAM)))
00119                 /* Try to grant enough space to send a full-size RPC */
00120                 return ofd_grant_inflate(ofd, chunk);
00121 
00122         /* Try to return enough to send two full-size RPCs
00123          * = 2 * (BRW_size + #extents_in_BRW * grant_tax) */
00124         tax = 1ULL << ofd->ofd_blockbits;            /* block size */
00125         tax *= ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_max_extent_blks; /* max extent size */
00126         tax = (chunk + tax - 1) / tax;               /* #extents in a RPC */
00127         tax *= ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_extent_tax;      /* extent tax for a RPC */
00128         chunk = (chunk + tax) * 2;                   /* we said two full RPCs */
00129         return chunk;
00130 }
00131 
00147 void ofd_grant_sanity_check(struct obd_device *obd, const char *func)
00148 {
00149         struct ofd_device *ofd = ofd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00150         struct obd_export *exp;
00151         u64                maxsize;
00152         u64                tot_dirty = 0;
00153         u64                tot_pending = 0;
00154         u64                tot_granted = 0;
00155         u64                fo_tot_granted;
00156         u64                fo_tot_pending;
00157         u64                fo_tot_dirty;
00158 
00159         if (list_empty(&obd->obd_exports))
00160                 return;
00161 
00162         /* We don't want to do this for large machines that do lots of
00163          * mounts or unmounts.  It burns... */
00164         if (obd->obd_num_exports > 100)
00165                 return;
00166 
00167         maxsize = ofd->ofd_osfs.os_blocks << ofd->ofd_blockbits;
00168 
00169         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00170         spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00171         list_for_each_entry(exp, &obd->obd_exports, exp_obd_chain) {
00172                 struct filter_export_data       *fed;
00173                 int                              error = 0;
00174 
00175                 fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
00176 
00177                 if (obd->obd_self_export == exp)
00178                         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: processing self export: %ld %ld "
00179                                "%ld\n", obd->obd_name, fed->fed_grant,
00180                                fed->fed_pending, fed->fed_dirty);
00181 
00182                 if (fed->fed_grant < 0 || fed->fed_pending < 0 ||
00183                     fed->fed_dirty < 0)
00184                         error = 1;
00185                 if (fed->fed_grant + fed->fed_pending > maxsize) {
00186                         CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p fed_grant(%ld) + fed_pending(%ld)"
00187                                " > maxsize("LPU64")\n", obd->obd_name,
00188                                exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, fed->fed_grant,
00189                                fed->fed_pending, maxsize);
00190                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00191                         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00192                         LBUG();
00193                 }
00194                 if (fed->fed_dirty > maxsize) {
00195                         CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p fed_dirty(%ld) > maxsize("LPU64
00196                                ")\n", obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00197                                exp, fed->fed_dirty, maxsize);
00198                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00199                         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00200                         LBUG();
00201                 }
00202                 CDEBUG_LIMIT(error ? D_ERROR : D_CACHE, "%s: cli %s/%p dirty "
00203                              "%ld pend %ld grant %ld\n", obd->obd_name,
00204                              exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, fed->fed_dirty,
00205                              fed->fed_pending, fed->fed_grant);
00206                 tot_granted += fed->fed_grant + fed->fed_pending;
00207                 tot_pending += fed->fed_pending;
00208                 tot_dirty += fed->fed_dirty;
00209         }
00210 
00211         /* exports about to be unlinked should also be taken into account since
00212          * they might still hold pending grant space to be released at
00213          * commit time */
00214         list_for_each_entry(exp, &obd->obd_unlinked_exports, exp_obd_chain) {
00215                 struct filter_export_data       *fed;
00216                 int                              error = 0;
00217 
00218                 fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
00219 
00220                 if (fed->fed_grant < 0 || fed->fed_pending < 0 ||
00221                     fed->fed_dirty < 0)
00222                         error = 1;
00223                 if (fed->fed_grant + fed->fed_pending > maxsize) {
00224                         CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p fed_grant(%ld) + fed_pending(%ld)"
00225                                " > maxsize("LPU64")\n", obd->obd_name,
00226                                exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, fed->fed_grant,
00227                                fed->fed_pending, maxsize);
00228                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00229                         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00230                         LBUG();
00231                 }
00232                 if (fed->fed_dirty > maxsize) {
00233                         CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p fed_dirty(%ld) > maxsize("LPU64
00234                                ")\n", obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00235                                exp, fed->fed_dirty, maxsize);
00236                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00237                         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00238                         LBUG();
00239                 }
00240                 CDEBUG_LIMIT(error ? D_ERROR : D_CACHE, "%s: cli %s/%p dirty "
00241                              "%ld pend %ld grant %ld\n", obd->obd_name,
00242                              exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, fed->fed_dirty,
00243                              fed->fed_pending, fed->fed_grant);
00244                 tot_granted += fed->fed_grant + fed->fed_pending;
00245                 tot_pending += fed->fed_pending;
00246                 tot_dirty += fed->fed_dirty;
00247         }
00248 
00249         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00250         fo_tot_granted = ofd->ofd_tot_granted;
00251         fo_tot_pending = ofd->ofd_tot_pending;
00252         fo_tot_dirty = ofd->ofd_tot_dirty;
00253 
00254         if (tot_granted != fo_tot_granted)
00255                 CERROR("%s: tot_granted "LPU64" != fo_tot_granted "LPU64"\n",
00256                        func, tot_granted, fo_tot_granted);
00257         if (tot_pending != fo_tot_pending)
00258                 CERROR("%s: tot_pending "LPU64" != fo_tot_pending "LPU64"\n",
00259                        func, tot_pending, fo_tot_pending);
00260         if (tot_dirty != fo_tot_dirty)
00261                 CERROR("%s: tot_dirty "LPU64" != fo_tot_dirty "LPU64"\n",
00262                        func, tot_dirty, fo_tot_dirty);
00263         if (tot_pending > tot_granted)
00264                 CERROR("%s: tot_pending "LPU64" > tot_granted "LPU64"\n",
00265                        func, tot_pending, tot_granted);
00266         if (tot_granted > maxsize)
00267                 CERROR("%s: tot_granted "LPU64" > maxsize "LPU64"\n",
00268                        func, tot_granted, maxsize);
00269         if (tot_dirty > maxsize)
00270                 CERROR("%s: tot_dirty "LPU64" > maxsize "LPU64"\n",
00271                        func, tot_dirty, maxsize);
00272         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00273 }
00274 
00290 static void ofd_grant_statfs(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00291                              int force, int *from_cache)
00292 {
00293         struct obd_device       *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00294         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00295         struct obd_statfs       *osfs = &ofd_info(env)->fti_u.osfs;
00296         __u64                    max_age;
00297         int                      rc;
00298 
00299         if (force)
00300                 max_age = 0; /* get fresh statfs data */
00301         else
00302                 max_age = cfs_time_shift_64(-OBD_STATFS_CACHE_SECONDS);
00303 
00304         rc = ofd_statfs_internal(env, ofd, osfs, max_age, from_cache);
00305         if (unlikely(rc)) {
00306                 if (from_cache)
00307                         *from_cache = 0;
00308                 return;
00309         }
00310 
00311         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: cli %s/%p free: "LPU64" avail: "LPU64"\n",
00312                obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
00313                osfs->os_bfree << ofd->ofd_blockbits,
00314                osfs->os_bavail << ofd->ofd_blockbits);
00315 }
00316 
00330 static u64 ofd_grant_space_left(struct obd_export *exp)
00331 {
00332         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00333         struct ofd_device *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00334         u64                tot_granted;
00335         u64                left;
00336         u64                avail;
00337         u64                unstable;
00338 
00339         ENTRY;
00340         assert_spin_locked(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00341 
00342         spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_osfs_lock);
00343         /* get available space from cached statfs data */
00344         left = ofd->ofd_osfs.os_bavail << ofd->ofd_blockbits;
00345         unstable = ofd->ofd_osfs_unstable; /* those might be accounted twice */
00346         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_osfs_lock);
00347 
00348         tot_granted = ofd->ofd_tot_granted;
00349 
00350         if (left < tot_granted) {
00351                 int mask = (left + unstable <
00352                             tot_granted - ofd->ofd_tot_pending) ?
00353                             D_ERROR : D_CACHE;
00354 
00355                 CDEBUG_LIMIT(mask, "%s: cli %s/%p left "LPU64" < tot_grant "
00356                              LPU64" unstable "LPU64" pending "LPU64" "
00357                              "dirty "LPU64"\n",
00358                              obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
00359                              left, tot_granted, unstable,
00360                              ofd->ofd_tot_pending, ofd->ofd_tot_dirty);
00361                 RETURN(0);
00362         }
00363 
00364         avail = left;
00365         /* Withdraw space already granted to clients */
00366         left -= tot_granted;
00367 
00368         /* Align left on block size */
00369         left &= ~((1ULL << ofd->ofd_blockbits) - 1);
00370 
00371         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: cli %s/%p avail "LPU64" left "LPU64" unstable "
00372                LPU64" tot_grant "LPU64" pending "LPU64"\n", obd->obd_name,
00373                exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, avail, left, unstable,
00374                tot_granted, ofd->ofd_tot_pending);
00375 
00376         RETURN(left);
00377 }
00378 
00393 static void ofd_grant_incoming(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00394                                struct obdo *oa, long chunk)
00395 {
00396         struct filter_export_data       *fed;
00397         struct ofd_device               *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00398         struct obd_device               *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00399         long                             dirty;
00400         long                             dropped;
00401         ENTRY;
00402 
00403         assert_spin_locked(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00404 
00405         if ((oa->o_valid & (OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS|OBD_MD_FLGRANT)) !=
00406                                         (OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS|OBD_MD_FLGRANT)) {
00407                 oa->o_valid &= ~OBD_MD_FLGRANT;
00408                 RETURN_EXIT;
00409         }
00410 
00411         fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
00412 
00413         /* Add some margin, since there is a small race if other RPCs arrive
00414          * out-or-order and have already consumed some grant.  We want to
00415          * leave this here in case there is a large error in accounting. */
00416         CDEBUG(D_CACHE,
00417                "%s: cli %s/%p reports grant "LPU64" dropped %u, local %lu\n",
00418                obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, oa->o_grant,
00419                oa->o_dropped, fed->fed_grant);
00420 
00421         if ((long long)oa->o_dirty < 0)
00422                 oa->o_dirty = 0;
00423 
00424         /* inflate grant counters if required */
00425         if (!ofd_grant_param_supp(exp)) {
00426                 oa->o_grant     = ofd_grant_inflate(ofd, oa->o_grant);
00427                 oa->o_dirty     = ofd_grant_inflate(ofd, oa->o_dirty);
00428                 oa->o_dropped   = ofd_grant_inflate(ofd, (u64)oa->o_dropped);
00429                 oa->o_undirty   = ofd_grant_inflate(ofd, oa->o_undirty);
00430         }
00431 
00432         dirty = oa->o_dirty;
00433         dropped = oa->o_dropped;
00434 
00435         /* Update our accounting now so that statfs takes it into account.
00436          * Note that fed_dirty is only approximate and can become incorrect
00437          * if RPCs arrive out-of-order.  No important calculations depend
00438          * on fed_dirty however, but we must check sanity to not assert. */
00439         if (dirty > fed->fed_grant + 4 * chunk)
00440                 dirty = fed->fed_grant + 4 * chunk;
00441         ofd->ofd_tot_dirty += dirty - fed->fed_dirty;
00442         if (fed->fed_grant < dropped) {
00443                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE,
00444                        "%s: cli %s/%p reports %lu dropped > grant %lu\n",
00445                        obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, dropped,
00446                        fed->fed_grant);
00447                 dropped = 0;
00448         }
00449         if (ofd->ofd_tot_granted < dropped) {
00450                 CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p reports %lu dropped > tot_grant "LPU64
00451                        "\n", obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
00452                        dropped, ofd->ofd_tot_granted);
00453                 dropped = 0;
00454         }
00455         ofd->ofd_tot_granted -= dropped;
00456         fed->fed_grant -= dropped;
00457         fed->fed_dirty = dirty;
00458 
00459         if (fed->fed_dirty < 0 || fed->fed_grant < 0 || fed->fed_pending < 0) {
00460                 CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p dirty %ld pend %ld grant %ld\n",
00461                        obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
00462                        fed->fed_dirty, fed->fed_pending, fed->fed_grant);
00463                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00464                 LBUG();
00465         }
00466         EXIT;
00467 }
00468 
00483 static void ofd_grant_shrink(struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa,
00484                              u64 left_space)
00485 {
00486         struct filter_export_data       *fed;
00487         struct ofd_device               *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00488         struct obd_device               *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00489         long                             grant_shrink;
00490 
00491         assert_spin_locked(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00492         LASSERT(exp);
00493         if (left_space >= ofd->ofd_tot_granted_clients *
00494                           OFD_GRANT_SHRINK_LIMIT(exp))
00495                 return;
00496 
00497         grant_shrink = oa->o_grant;
00498 
00499         fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
00500         fed->fed_grant       -= grant_shrink;
00501         ofd->ofd_tot_granted -= grant_shrink;
00502 
00503         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: cli %s/%p shrink %ld fed_grant %ld total "
00504                LPU64"\n", obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00505                exp, grant_shrink, fed->fed_grant, ofd->ofd_tot_granted);
00506 
00507         /* client has just released some grant, don't grant any space back */
00508         oa->o_grant = 0;
00509 }
00510 
00529 static inline u64 ofd_grant_rnb_size(struct obd_export *exp,
00530                                      struct ofd_device *ofd,
00531                                      struct niobuf_remote *rnb)
00532 {
00533         u64 blksize;
00534         u64 bytes;
00535         u64 end;
00536 
00537         if (exp && !ofd_grant_param_supp(exp) &&
00538             ofd->ofd_blockbits > COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT)
00539                 blksize = 1ULL << COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT;
00540         else
00541                 blksize = 1ULL << ofd->ofd_blockbits;
00542 
00543         /* The network buffer might span several blocks, align it on block
00544          * boundaries */
00545         bytes  = rnb->rnb_offset & (blksize - 1);
00546         bytes += rnb->rnb_len;
00547         end    = bytes & (blksize - 1);
00548         if (end)
00549                 bytes += blksize - end;
00550 
00551         if (exp == NULL || ofd_grant_param_supp(exp)) {
00552                 /* add per-extent insertion cost */
00553                 u64 max_ext;
00554                 int nr_ext;
00555 
00556                 max_ext = blksize * ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_max_extent_blks;
00557                 nr_ext = (bytes + max_ext - 1) / max_ext;
00558                 bytes += nr_ext * ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_extent_tax;
00559         } else {
00560                 /* Inflate grant space if client does not support extent-based
00561                  * grant allocation */
00562                 bytes = ofd_grant_inflate(ofd, (u64)bytes);
00563         }
00564 
00565         return bytes;
00566 }
00567 
00591 static void ofd_grant_check(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00592                             struct obdo *oa, struct niobuf_remote *rnb,
00593                             int niocount, u64 *left)
00594 {
00595         struct filter_export_data       *fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
00596         struct obd_device               *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00597         struct ofd_device               *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00598         unsigned long                    ungranted = 0;
00599         unsigned long                    granted = 0;
00600         int                              i;
00601         bool                             skip = false;
00602         struct ofd_thread_info          *info = ofd_info(env);
00603 
00604         ENTRY;
00605 
00606         assert_spin_locked(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00607 
00608         if (obd->obd_recovering) {
00609                 /* Replaying write. Grant info have been processed already so no
00610                  * need to do any enforcement here. It is worth noting that only
00611                  * bulk writes with all rnbs having OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT can be
00612                  * replayed. If one page hasn't OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT set, then
00613                  * the whole bulk is written synchronously */
00614                 skip = true;
00615                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "Replaying write, skipping accounting\n");
00616         } else if ((oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS) &&
00617                    (oa->o_flags & OBD_FL_RECOV_RESEND)) {
00618                 /* Recoverable resend, grant info have already been processed as
00619                  * well */
00620                 skip = true;
00621                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "Recoverable resend arrived, skipping "
00622                                 "accounting\n");
00623         } else if (ofd_grant_param_supp(exp) && oa->o_grant_used > 0) {
00624                 /* Client supports the new grant parameters and is telling us
00625                  * how much grant space it consumed for this bulk write.
00626                  * Although all rnbs are supposed to have the OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT
00627                  * flag set, we will scan the rnb list and looks for non-cache
00628                  * I/O in case it changes in the future */
00629                 if (fed->fed_grant >= oa->o_grant_used) {
00630                         /* skip grant accounting for rnbs with
00631                          * OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT and just used grant consumption
00632                          * claimed in the request */
00633                         granted = oa->o_grant_used;
00634                         skip = true;
00635                 } else {
00636                         /* client has used more grants for this request that
00637                          * it owns ... */
00638                         CERROR("%s: cli %s claims %lu GRANT, real grant %lu\n",
00639                                exp->exp_obd->obd_name,
00640                                exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00641                                (unsigned long)oa->o_grant_used, fed->fed_grant);
00642 
00643                         /* check whether we can fill the gap with unallocated
00644                          * grant */
00645                         if (*left > (oa->o_grant_used - fed->fed_grant)) {
00646                                 /* ouf .. we are safe for now */
00647                                 granted = fed->fed_grant;
00648                                 ungranted = oa->o_grant_used - granted;
00649                                 *left -= ungranted;
00650                                 skip = true;
00651                         }
00652                         /* too bad, but we cannot afford to blow up our grant
00653                          * accounting. The loop below will handle each rnb in
00654                          * case by case. */
00655                 }
00656         }
00657 
00658         for (i = 0; i < niocount; i++) {
00659                 int bytes;
00660 
00661                 if ((rnb[i].rnb_flags & OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT)) {
00662                         if (skip) {
00663                                 rnb[i].rnb_flags |= OBD_BRW_GRANTED;
00664                                 continue;
00665                         }
00666 
00667                         /* compute how much grant space is actually needed for
00668                          * this rnb, inflate grant if required */
00669                         bytes = ofd_grant_rnb_size(exp, ofd, &rnb[i]);
00670                         if (fed->fed_grant >= granted + bytes) {
00671                                 granted += bytes;
00672                                 rnb[i].rnb_flags |= OBD_BRW_GRANTED;
00673                                 continue;
00674                         }
00675 
00676                         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: cli %s/%p claims %ld+%d GRANT, "
00677                                "real grant %lu idx %d\n", obd->obd_name,
00678                                exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, granted, bytes,
00679                                fed->fed_grant, i);
00680                 }
00681 
00682                 if (obd->obd_recovering)
00683                         CERROR("%s: cli %s is replaying OST_WRITE while one rnb"
00684                                " hasn't OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT set (0x%x)\n",
00685                                obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00686                                rnb[i].rnb_flags);
00687 
00688                 /* Consume grant space on the server.
00689                  * Unlike above, ofd_grant_rnb_size() is called with exp = NULL
00690                  * so that the required grant space isn't inflated. This is
00691                  * done on purpose since the server can deal with large block
00692                  * size, unlike some clients */
00693                 bytes = ofd_grant_rnb_size(NULL, ofd, &rnb[i]);
00694                 if (*left > bytes) {
00695                         /* if enough space, pretend it was granted */
00696                         ungranted += bytes;
00697                         *left -= bytes;
00698                         rnb[i].rnb_flags |= OBD_BRW_GRANTED;
00699                         continue;
00700                 }
00701 
00702                 /* We can't check for already-mapped blocks here (make sense
00703                  * when backend filesystem does not use COW) as it requires
00704                  * dropping the grant lock.
00705                  * Instead, we clear OBD_BRW_GRANTED and in that case we need
00706                  * to go through and verify if all of the blocks not marked
00707                  *  BRW_GRANTED are already mapped and we can ignore this error.
00708                  */
00709                 rnb[i].rnb_flags &= ~OBD_BRW_GRANTED;
00710                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE,"%s: cli %s/%p idx %d no space for %d\n",
00711                        obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, i, bytes);
00712         }
00713 
00714         /* record in o_grant_used the actual space reserved for the I/O, will be
00715          * used later in ofd_grant_commmit() */
00716         oa->o_grant_used = granted + ungranted;
00717         info->fti_used = granted + ungranted;
00718 
00719         /* record space used for the I/O, will be used in ofd_grant_commmit() */
00720         /* Now substract what the clients has used already.  We don't subtract
00721          * this from the tot_granted yet, so that other client's can't grab
00722          * that space before we have actually allocated our blocks. That
00723          * happens in ofd_grant_commit() after the writes are done. */
00724         fed->fed_grant -= granted;
00725         fed->fed_pending += oa->o_grant_used;
00726         ofd->ofd_tot_granted += ungranted;
00727         ofd->ofd_tot_pending += oa->o_grant_used;
00728 
00729         CDEBUG(D_CACHE,
00730                "%s: cli %s/%p granted: %lu ungranted: %lu grant: %lu dirty: %lu"
00731                "\n", obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
00732                granted, ungranted, fed->fed_grant, fed->fed_dirty);
00733 
00734         if (obd->obd_recovering || (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLGRANT) == 0)
00735                 /* don't update dirty accounting during recovery or
00736                  * if grant information got discarded (e.g. during resend) */
00737                 RETURN_EXIT;
00738 
00739         if (fed->fed_dirty < granted) {
00740                 CWARN("%s: cli %s/%p claims granted %lu > fed_dirty %lu\n",
00741                        obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
00742                        granted, fed->fed_dirty);
00743                 granted = fed->fed_dirty;
00744         }
00745         ofd->ofd_tot_dirty -= granted;
00746         fed->fed_dirty -= granted;
00747 
00748         if (fed->fed_dirty < 0 || fed->fed_grant < 0 || fed->fed_pending < 0) {
00749                 CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p dirty %ld pend %ld grant %ld\n",
00750                        obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
00751                        fed->fed_dirty, fed->fed_pending, fed->fed_grant);
00752                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00753                 LBUG();
00754         }
00755         EXIT;
00756 }
00757 
00778 static long ofd_grant_alloc(struct obd_export *exp, u64 curgrant,
00779                             u64 want, u64 left, long chunk,
00780                             bool conservative)
00781 {
00782         struct obd_device               *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00783         struct ofd_device               *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00784         struct filter_export_data       *fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
00785         u64                              grant;
00786 
00787         ENTRY;
00788 
00789         if (ofd_grant_prohibit(exp, ofd) || left == 0 || exp->exp_failed)
00790                 RETURN(0);
00791 
00792         if (want > 0x7fffffff) {
00793                 CERROR("%s: client %s/%p requesting > 2GB grant "LPU64"\n",
00794                        obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, want);
00795                 RETURN(0);
00796         }
00797 
00798         /* Grant some fraction of the client's requested grant space so that
00799          * they are not always waiting for write credits (not all of it to
00800          * avoid overgranting in face of multiple RPCs in flight).  This
00801          * essentially will be able to control the OSC_MAX_RIF for a client.
00802          *
00803          * If we do have a large disparity between what the client thinks it
00804          * has and what we think it has, don't grant very much and let the
00805          * client consume its grant first.  Either it just has lots of RPCs
00806          * in flight, or it was evicted and its grants will soon be used up. */
00807         if (curgrant >= want || curgrant >= fed->fed_grant + chunk)
00808                 RETURN(0);
00809 
00810         if (obd->obd_recovering)
00811                 conservative = false;
00812 
00813         if (conservative)
00814                 /* don't grant more than 1/8th of the remaining free space in
00815                  * one chunk */
00816                 left >>= 3;
00817         grant = min(want - curgrant, left);
00818         /* round grant up to the next block size */
00819         grant = (grant + (1 << ofd->ofd_blockbits) - 1) &
00820                 ~((1ULL << ofd->ofd_blockbits) - 1);
00821 
00822         if (!grant)
00823                 RETURN(0);
00824 
00825         /* Limit to grant_chunk if not reconnect/recovery */
00826         if ((grant > chunk) && conservative)
00827                 grant = chunk;
00828 
00829         ofd->ofd_tot_granted += grant;
00830         fed->fed_grant += grant;
00831 
00832         if (fed->fed_grant < 0) {
00833                 CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p grant %ld want "LPU64" current "LPU64"\n",
00834                        obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
00835                        fed->fed_grant, want, curgrant);
00836                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00837                 LBUG();
00838         }
00839 
00840         CDEBUG(D_CACHE,
00841                "%s: cli %s/%p wants: "LPU64" current grant "LPU64
00842                " granting: "LPU64"\n", obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00843                exp, want, curgrant, grant);
00844         CDEBUG(D_CACHE,
00845                "%s: cli %s/%p tot cached:"LPU64" granted:"LPU64
00846                " num_exports: %d\n", obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00847                exp, ofd->ofd_tot_dirty, ofd->ofd_tot_granted,
00848                obd->obd_num_exports);
00849 
00850         RETURN(grant);
00851 }
00852 
00868 void ofd_grant_connect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00869                        struct obd_connect_data *data, bool new_conn)
00870 {
00871         struct ofd_device               *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00872         struct filter_export_data       *fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
00873         u64                              left = 0;
00874         u64                              want;
00875         long                             chunk;
00876         int                              from_cache;
00877         int                              force = 0; /* can use cached data */
00878 
00879         /* don't grant space to client with read-only access */
00880         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, RDONLY) ||
00881             (!OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, GRANT_PARAM) &&
00882              ofd->ofd_grant_compat_disable)) {
00883                 data->ocd_grant = 0;
00884                 data->ocd_connect_flags &= ~(OBD_CONNECT_GRANT |
00885                                              OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM);
00886                 RETURN_EXIT;
00887         }
00888 
00889         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, GRANT_PARAM))
00890                 want = data->ocd_grant;
00891         else
00892                 want = ofd_grant_inflate(ofd, data->ocd_grant);
00893         chunk = ofd_grant_chunk(exp, ofd, data);
00894 refresh:
00895         ofd_grant_statfs(env, exp, force, &from_cache);
00896 
00897         spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00898 
00899         /* Grab free space from cached info and take out space already granted
00900          * to clients as well as reserved space */
00901         left = ofd_grant_space_left(exp);
00902 
00903         /* get fresh statfs data if we are short in ungranted space */
00904         if (from_cache && left < 32 * chunk) {
00905                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00906                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "fs has no space left and statfs too old\n");
00907                 force = 1;
00908                 goto refresh;
00909         }
00910 
00911         ofd_grant_alloc(exp, (u64)fed->fed_grant, want, left, chunk, new_conn);
00912 
00913         /* return to client its current grant */
00914         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, GRANT_PARAM))
00915                 data->ocd_grant = fed->fed_grant;
00916         else
00917                 /* deflate grant */
00918                 data->ocd_grant = ofd_grant_deflate(ofd,
00919                                                     (u64)fed->fed_grant);
00920 
00921         /* reset dirty accounting */
00922         ofd->ofd_tot_dirty -= fed->fed_dirty;
00923         fed->fed_dirty = 0;
00924 
00925         if (new_conn && OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, GRANT))
00926                 ofd->ofd_tot_granted_clients++;
00927 
00928         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00929 
00930         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: cli %s/%p ocd_grant: %d want: "LPU64" left: "
00931                LPU64"\n", exp->exp_obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00932                exp, data->ocd_grant, want, left);
00933 
00934         EXIT;
00935 }
00936 
00947 void ofd_grant_discard(struct obd_export *exp)
00948 {
00949         struct obd_device               *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00950         struct ofd_device               *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00951         struct filter_export_data       *fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
00952 
00953         spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00954         LASSERTF(ofd->ofd_tot_granted >= fed->fed_grant,
00955                  "%s: tot_granted "LPU64" cli %s/%p fed_grant %ld\n",
00956                  obd->obd_name, ofd->ofd_tot_granted,
00957                  exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, fed->fed_grant);
00958         ofd->ofd_tot_granted -= fed->fed_grant;
00959         fed->fed_grant = 0;
00960         LASSERTF(ofd->ofd_tot_pending >= fed->fed_pending,
00961                  "%s: tot_pending "LPU64" cli %s/%p fed_pending %ld\n",
00962                  obd->obd_name, ofd->ofd_tot_pending,
00963                  exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, fed->fed_pending);
00964         /* ofd_tot_pending is handled in ofd_grant_commit as bulk
00965          * commmits */
00966         LASSERTF(ofd->ofd_tot_dirty >= fed->fed_dirty,
00967                  "%s: tot_dirty "LPU64" cli %s/%p fed_dirty %ld\n",
00968                  obd->obd_name, ofd->ofd_tot_dirty,
00969                  exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, fed->fed_dirty);
00970         ofd->ofd_tot_dirty -= fed->fed_dirty;
00971         fed->fed_dirty = 0;
00972         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00973 }
00974 
00988 void ofd_grant_prepare_read(const struct lu_env *env,
00989                             struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa)
00990 {
00991         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00992         int                      do_shrink;
00993         u64                      left = 0;
00994         ENTRY;
00995 
00996         if (!oa)
00997                 RETURN_EXIT;
00998 
00999         if ((oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLGRANT) == 0)
01000                 /* The read request does not contain any grant
01001                  * information */
01002                 RETURN_EXIT;
01003 
01004         if ((oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS) &&
01005             (oa->o_flags & OBD_FL_SHRINK_GRANT)) {
01006                 /* To process grant shrink request, we need to know how much
01007                  * available space remains on the backend filesystem.
01008                  * Shrink requests are not so common, we always get fresh
01009                  * statfs information. */
01010                 ofd_grant_statfs(env, exp, 1, NULL);
01011 
01012                 /* protect all grant counters */
01013                 spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01014 
01015                 /* Grab free space from cached statfs data and take out space
01016                  * already granted to clients as well as reserved space */
01017                 left = ofd_grant_space_left(exp);
01018 
01019                 /* all set now to proceed with shrinking */
01020                 do_shrink = 1;
01021         } else {
01022                 /* no grant shrinking request packed in the obdo and
01023                  * since we don't grant space back on reads, no point
01024                  * in running statfs, so just skip it and process
01025                  * incoming grant data directly. */
01026                 spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01027                 do_shrink = 0;
01028         }
01029 
01030         /* extract incoming grant information provided by the client and
01031          * inflate grant counters if required */
01032         ofd_grant_incoming(env, exp, oa, ofd_grant_chunk(exp, ofd, NULL));
01033 
01034         /* unlike writes, we don't return grants back on reads unless a grant
01035          * shrink request was packed and we decided to turn it down. */
01036         if (do_shrink)
01037                 ofd_grant_shrink(exp, oa, left);
01038         else
01039                 oa->o_grant = 0;
01040 
01041         if (!ofd_grant_param_supp(exp))
01042                 oa->o_grant = ofd_grant_deflate(ofd, oa->o_grant);
01043         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01044         EXIT;
01045 }
01046 
01068 void ofd_grant_prepare_write(const struct lu_env *env,
01069                              struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa,
01070                              struct niobuf_remote *rnb, int niocount)
01071 {
01072         struct obd_device       *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01073         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
01074         u64                      left;
01075         int                      from_cache;
01076         int                      force = 0; /* can use cached data intially */
01077         long                     chunk = ofd_grant_chunk(exp, ofd, NULL);
01078         int                      rc;
01079 
01080         ENTRY;
01081 
01082 refresh:
01083         /* get statfs information from OSD layer */
01084         ofd_grant_statfs(env, exp, force, &from_cache);
01085 
01086         spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock); /* protect all grant counters */
01087 
01088         /* Grab free space from cached statfs data and take out space already
01089          * granted to clients as well as reserved space */
01090         left = ofd_grant_space_left(exp);
01091 
01092         /* Get fresh statfs data if we are short in ungranted space */
01093         if (from_cache && left < 32 * chunk) {
01094                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01095                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: fs has no space left and statfs too old\n",
01096                        obd->obd_name);
01097                 force = 1;
01098                 goto refresh;
01099         }
01100 
01101         /* When close to free space exhaustion, trigger a sync to force
01102          * writeback cache to consume required space immediately and release as
01103          * much space as possible. */
01104         if (!obd->obd_recovering && force != 2 && left < chunk) {
01105                 bool from_grant = true;
01106                 int  i;
01107 
01108                 /* That said, it is worth running a sync only if some pages did
01109                  * not consume grant space on the client and could thus fail
01110                  * with ENOSPC later in ofd_grant_check() */
01111                 for (i = 0; i < niocount; i++)
01112                         if (!(rnb[i].rnb_flags & OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT))
01113                                 from_grant = false;
01114 
01115                 if (!from_grant) {
01116                         /* at least one network buffer requires acquiring grant
01117                          * space on the server */
01118                         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01119                         /* discard errors, at least we tried ... */
01120                         rc = dt_sync(env, ofd->ofd_osd);
01121                         force = 2;
01122                         goto refresh;
01123                 }
01124         }
01125 
01126         /* extract incoming grant information provided by the client,
01127          * and inflate grant counters if required */
01128         ofd_grant_incoming(env, exp, oa, chunk);
01129 
01130         /* check limit */
01131         ofd_grant_check(env, exp, oa, rnb, niocount, &left);
01132 
01133         if (!(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLGRANT)) {
01134                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01135                 RETURN_EXIT;
01136         }
01137 
01138         /* if OBD_FL_SHRINK_GRANT is set, the client is willing to release some
01139          * grant space. */
01140         if ((oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS) &&
01141             (oa->o_flags & OBD_FL_SHRINK_GRANT))
01142                 ofd_grant_shrink(exp, oa, left);
01143         else
01144                 /* grant more space back to the client if possible */
01145                 oa->o_grant = ofd_grant_alloc(exp, oa->o_grant, oa->o_undirty,
01146                                               left, chunk, true);
01147 
01148         if (!ofd_grant_param_supp(exp))
01149                 oa->o_grant = ofd_grant_deflate(ofd, oa->o_grant);
01150         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01151         EXIT;
01152 }
01153 
01172 long ofd_grant_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp, int *nr)
01173 {
01174         struct ofd_device               *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
01175         struct filter_export_data       *fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
01176         u64                              left = 0;
01177         unsigned long                    wanted;
01178         unsigned long                    granted;
01179         ENTRY;
01180 
01181         if (exp->exp_obd->obd_recovering ||
01182             ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_inodespace == 0)
01183                 /* don't enforce grant during recovery */
01184                 RETURN(0);
01185 
01186         /* Update statfs data if required */
01187         ofd_grant_statfs(env, exp, 1, NULL);
01188 
01189         /* protect all grant counters */
01190         spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01191 
01192         /* fail precreate request if there is not enough blocks available for
01193          * writing */
01194         if (ofd->ofd_osfs.os_bavail - (fed->fed_grant >> ofd->ofd_blockbits) <
01195             (ofd->ofd_osfs.os_blocks >> 10)) {
01196                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01197                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "%s: not enough space for create "LPU64"\n",
01198                        ofd_name(ofd),
01199                        ofd->ofd_osfs.os_bavail * ofd->ofd_osfs.os_blocks);
01200                 RETURN(-ENOSPC);
01201         }
01202 
01203         /* Grab free space from cached statfs data and take out space
01204          * already granted to clients as well as reserved space */
01205         left = ofd_grant_space_left(exp);
01206 
01207         /* compute how much space is required to handle the precreation
01208          * request */
01209         wanted = *nr * ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_inodespace;
01210         if (wanted > fed->fed_grant + left) {
01211                 /* that's beyond what remains, adjust the number of objects that
01212                  * can be safely precreated */
01213                 wanted = fed->fed_grant + left;
01214                 *nr = wanted / ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_inodespace;
01215                 if (*nr == 0) {
01216                         /* we really have no space any more for precreation,
01217                          * fail the precreate request with ENOSPC */
01218                         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01219                         RETURN(-ENOSPC);
01220                 }
01221                 /* compute space needed for the new number of creations */
01222                 wanted = *nr * ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_inodespace;
01223         }
01224         LASSERT(wanted <= fed->fed_grant + left);
01225 
01226         if (wanted <= fed->fed_grant) {
01227                 /* we've enough grant space to handle this precreate request */
01228                 fed->fed_grant -= wanted;
01229         } else {
01230                 /* we need to take some space from the ungranted pool */
01231                 ofd->ofd_tot_granted += wanted - fed->fed_grant;
01232                 left -= wanted - fed->fed_grant;
01233                 fed->fed_grant = 0;
01234         }
01235         granted = wanted;
01236         fed->fed_pending += granted;
01237         ofd->ofd_tot_pending += granted;
01238 
01239         /* grant more space for precreate purpose if possible. */
01240         wanted = OST_MAX_PRECREATE * ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_inodespace / 2;
01241         if (wanted > fed->fed_grant) {
01242                 long chunk;
01243 
01244                 /* always try to book enough space to handle a large precreate
01245                  * request */
01246                 chunk = ofd_grant_chunk(exp, ofd, NULL);
01247                 wanted -= fed->fed_grant;
01248                 ofd_grant_alloc(exp, fed->fed_grant, wanted, left, chunk,
01249                                 false);
01250         }
01251         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01252         RETURN(granted);
01253 }
01254 
01264 void ofd_grant_commit(struct obd_export *exp, unsigned long pending,
01265                       int rc)
01266 {
01267         struct ofd_device       *ofd  = ofd_exp(exp);
01268         ENTRY;
01269 
01270         /* get space accounted in tot_pending for the I/O, set in
01271          * ofd_grant_check() */
01272         if (pending == 0)
01273                 RETURN_EXIT;
01274 
01275         spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01276         /* Don't update statfs data for errors raised before commit (e.g.
01277          * bulk transfer failed, ...) since we know those writes have not been
01278          * processed. For other errors hit during commit, we cannot really tell
01279          * whether or not something was written, so we update statfs data.
01280          * In any case, this should not be fatal since we always get fresh
01281          * statfs data before failing a request with ENOSPC */
01282         if (rc == 0) {
01283                 spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_osfs_lock);
01284                 /* Take pending out of cached statfs data */
01285                 ofd->ofd_osfs.os_bavail -= min_t(u64,
01286                                                  ofd->ofd_osfs.os_bavail,
01287                                                  pending >> ofd->ofd_blockbits);
01288                 if (ofd->ofd_statfs_inflight)
01289                         /* someone is running statfs and want to be notified of
01290                          * writes happening meanwhile */
01291                         ofd->ofd_osfs_inflight += pending;
01292                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_osfs_lock);
01293         }
01294 
01295         if (exp->exp_filter_data.fed_pending < pending) {
01296                 CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p fed_pending(%lu) < grant_used(%lu)\n",
01297                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
01298                        exp->exp_filter_data.fed_pending, pending);
01299                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01300                 LBUG();
01301         }
01302         exp->exp_filter_data.fed_pending -= pending;
01303 
01304         if (ofd->ofd_tot_granted < pending) {
01305                  CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p tot_granted("LPU64") < grant_used(%lu)"
01306                         "\n", exp->exp_obd->obd_name,
01307                         exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp, ofd->ofd_tot_granted,
01308                         pending);
01309                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01310                 LBUG();
01311         }
01312         ofd->ofd_tot_granted -= pending;
01313 
01314         if (ofd->ofd_tot_pending < pending) {
01315                  CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p tot_pending("LPU64") < grant_used(%lu)"
01316                         "\n", exp->exp_obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
01317                         exp, ofd->ofd_tot_pending, pending);
01318                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01319                 LBUG();
01320         }
01321         ofd->ofd_tot_pending -= pending;
01322         spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
01323         EXIT;
01324 }
01325 
01326 struct ofd_grant_cb {
01327         /* commit callback structure */
01328         struct dt_txn_commit_cb  ogc_cb;
01329         /* export associated with the bulk write */
01330         struct obd_export       *ogc_exp;
01331         /* pending grant to be released */
01332         unsigned long            ogc_granted;
01333 };
01334 
01345 static void ofd_grant_commit_cb(struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
01346                                 struct dt_txn_commit_cb *cb, int err)
01347 {
01348         struct ofd_grant_cb     *ogc;
01349 
01350         ogc = container_of(cb, struct ofd_grant_cb, ogc_cb);
01351 
01352         ofd_grant_commit(ogc->ogc_exp, ogc->ogc_granted, err);
01353         class_export_cb_put(ogc->ogc_exp);
01354         OBD_FREE_PTR(ogc);
01355 }
01356 
01369 int ofd_grant_commit_cb_add(struct thandle *th, struct obd_export *exp,
01370                             unsigned long granted)
01371 {
01372         struct ofd_grant_cb     *ogc;
01373         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb;
01374         int                      rc;
01375         ENTRY;
01376 
01377         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ogc);
01378         if (ogc == NULL)
01379                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01380 
01381         ogc->ogc_exp = class_export_cb_get(exp);
01382         ogc->ogc_granted = granted;
01383 
01384         dcb = &ogc->ogc_cb;
01385         dcb->dcb_func = ofd_grant_commit_cb;
01386         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dcb->dcb_linkage);
01387         strlcpy(dcb->dcb_name, "ofd_grant_commit_cb", sizeof(dcb->dcb_name));
01388 
01389         rc = dt_trans_cb_add(th, dcb);
01390         if (rc) {
01391                 class_export_cb_put(ogc->ogc_exp);
01392                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ogc);
01393         }
01394 
01395         RETURN(rc);
01396 }
